item.title: Autism Awareness And The Blue Ranger
item.description: It’s the start of “Autism Awareness Month,” which, for those of us with Autism, tends to be “the month to run and hide and wish I didn’t like blue, because we get inundated with neurotypical people who think they know our experience better than we do.” I don’t often write about the effect of Autism on my life (either my son’s or my own’s), because to be honest, 99% of the time, it’s boring and uneventful.
